Pre-Game Insights: The Pirates, at -124, are the favorites in this game, while the Nationals are underdogs at +104.
For this contest, Pittsburgh (-1.5) is favored on the run line with +162 odds.
This matchup carries a total of 8.5 runs (over -107; under -113).

Bryan Reynolds is walking 8.3% of the time and striking out at a 22.4% clip while putting up a .280 batting average, a .347 OBP, and a .457 SLG (.804 OPS). He has also launched 22 dingers with 78 RBI, 10 stolen bases, and 67 runs scored.

In 524 plate appearances, Oneil Cruz has tallied 18 homers, 68 RBI, 21 steals, and 61 runs while putting up a .268/.326/.460 triple slash. His walk rate is 7.6%, and he’s striking out 30.9% of the time.

The Nationals’ C.J. Abrams has hit 18 homers and picked up 62 RBI so far this year, plus stolen 28 bases on 40 attempts. He has 72 runs scored, a strikeout rate of 21%, and a walk rate of 6.8%. His slash line is .240/.311/.423.
The slash line for Luis Garcia is .290/.328/.452. He has 15 homers and 63 RBI, with 49 runs scored, plus 21 stolen bases on 25 attempts. His strikeout rate is 15.9%, and his walk rate is 5.4%.
